website_summaries.verdict: Many diabetics seek an ideal depth setting for different fingers or alternative test sites. We think this contender's 10 gauge settings makes it a great choice for dialing in the most painless depth.
pros: Longer barrel length makes it easier to hold
10 depth settings instead of the standard five
Slide mechanism ejects used lancet, so there's no handling required
cons: Some lancet brands do not seat properly
Does not break skin at lower settings
May not snap back after discharge

customer_reviews.title: Best Lancing Device I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best lancing device I have ever used and I have been testing my blood for 20+ years. It is small enough to be convenient but easy to handle and the settings are great. I have some fingers that have developed a tough skin and the 10 setting gets thru this easily while I use the lower settings 1-5 for most of my other fingers. I highly recommend this device and the seller handled my order quickly and accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL!!
customer_reviews.text: I have done so many finger-sticks over the years that my fingers are like leather! I always have to turn the device up to the highest setting to get any blood at all. Well, the Care Touch device is FABULOUS! I'm only set on 7 and I get plenty of blood each and every time! When I started using it, I kept thinking it wasn't working, because I didn't feel the stick, but when I look, son of a gun, the blood was there! I love this device! I ordered 2 at first; I'm going to have to order 1 more so all my test kits will have one. Thank you Care Touch!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaatje

customer_reviews.title: and liked it. For me
customer_reviews.text: Got it, used it, and liked it. For me, this device is far superior to the OneTouch Delica and at least as good as the OneTouch Ultra, which I can no longer buy. Based on my experience, I cannot imagine that Johnson and Johnson adequately tested the Delica (it is small and attractive, but it does not work for me). I test on the forearm and the two times I tested I got ample blood and no pain. I used OneTouch strips, but I did not insert them all the way down into the barrel ( I left it about 1/8" from fully inserted). Sweet!. I will purchase two more, one as a backup and another for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Oestreich

customer_reviews.title: I prefer the Care Touch Lancing Device over my OneTouch Delica or my Microlet 2 Device
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice for a lancet pen. Big enough to hold. Positive snap when you twist the head of the device over the loaded lancet. Slide moves to eject used lancets right into your sharps box. I love the size because it easily fits in my glucometer kit. I have a one touch Delicia and the Microlet 2 lancet devices at my disposal but, it is the Care Touch pen I reach for first
customer_reviews.author: HappyGoLuken

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I test off my arm instead of my fingers since I test very often and "standard" testers would take 8-10 pokes to get a large enough drop to test. Generally with this one it takes 1-2 which is wonderful to me. The order shipped quickly and was delivered quickly. The package was sufficient to protect the little box inside from getting damaged at all. I would recommend it for anyone who tests several times a day. The only concern I would have is durability and if it will continue to work as well in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Type 1 of 28 years APPROVED!
customer_reviews.text: Type 1 diabetic for 28 years here... This thing is the BEST. I lost my lancing device in the abyss (my car) when my purse spilled, and for the first time ever had to order a new lancing device on Amazon. It came SO quickly, and the raving reviews are all correct; great value for such a wonderful, painless, easy to use device. I would HIGHLY recommend this for children, as I am more sensitive to finger pokes than infusion sets, and you really DON'T feel it, and get a great amount of blood the first try. If giving this more than 5 stars were possible, I would!
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Works with Microlet Needles
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect substitute for the microlet 2 lancing device that broke in a couple of month of use. While it doesn't feel as sturdy, I prefer this over the Microlet 2 Lancing Device. The 10 depth settings make it easy to adjust based on what you need. It also didn't hurt as much as the branded lancing device and drew enough blood to get a good reading without having to re-puncture the skin. The little button to remove the needle is very useful and the biggest plus point is that it works with the Microlet needle so you don't have to buy another whole set of new needles. Worth the price! Time will tell how long it'll last.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Far less painful to use than either CVS or Rite-Aid brand lancing devices.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using lancing devices from Rite-Aid and CVS for the past decade. I thought that the sharp pain caused by those brands was just part of the diabetic lifestyle. When my last CVS lancer bit the dust I decided to give this a chance. WOW! What a difference. The best I can figure, the spring on the Care Touch is of higher quality. I can set the adjustment about two notches lower than the Rite-Aid or CVS devices and still get a good drop of blood. Two notches lower means that it doesn't poke through my skin as far as the others. At least in my case, less depth = less pain.
customer_reviews.author: Nervous and Weird

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy use. Just remove the clear top piece by twisting and insert your Lancet. I bought the same brand Lancet without realizing it but this device is made to fit most round shaped lancets so you don't have to get a specific brand. It makes pricking my finger much easier and a lot less painful. Just click the button and it darts and retracts very quickly. Definitely beats trying to stab my finger without help
customer_reviews.author: Online shopping lover

customer_reviews.title: Without a doubt the very BEST lancet device I've used since 2009! JUST BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: As my headline states, this lancet device is, without a doubt, the absolute BEST I've used since being diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes in 2009! Believe me, I've tried many different devices and found them poorly made, thus they performed poorly as well! This lancet device easily accepts those lancets that are round. My skin is rather thick therefore I must set the puncture depth on 10. Simply amazing! The puncture itself was so quick, so painless, and delivered a drop of blood that was MORE THAN ENOUGH! Thanks for reading this. Just buy one. Or two. Or three!
customer_reviews.author: Donald A. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Update:  The Lancing Device malfunctioned after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I had given this 4 stars. The only reasons I had given 4 stars to this product are because the device seemed so fragile, and I prefer to recap the needles for safety sake after use. After just three uses, this lancing device became defective. Even on the number 10 setting, it was not deep enough to draw any blood so that I could not do my glucose test.
customer_reviews.author: Linda LeeTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Months of consistent performance.
customer_reviews.text: After months of use this has become my favorite lancer. The force of the sharp piercing the skin is always consistent. I also love how easy it is to eject the sharp. I wish there was a setting with slightly less impact. However, depending on which finger, and because impact is so consistent, I can compensate by varying how hard I press my finger onto the lancer. After too many years of testing this definitely is my favorite lancer. I was not compensated for this review. Update 12/2019 The lancer’s piercing impact is still consistent, and reliable as when I first purchased it. Still loving the easy of the sharp removal. I wouldn’t hesitate to purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: Bead lover Linda

customer_reviews.title: Didn't function properly
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for one BST and it failed in all respects except for making holes in my finger. The problem is that I can't get the lancet to seat all the way into the device, which leaves the lance sticking out of the hole that normally rests on the skin before pressing the button. Either it has some sort of reset device requires the change each time of the lancet, or there is a simple problem causing the lancet not to seat properly (perhaps quality control issue). Either way, one and done for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sadak

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, takes almost any standard lance. Pain is greatly reduced compared to any other similar product I've tried.
customer_reviews.text: Makes my life easier. This is not quite painless, but the spring mechanism keeps the tip of the lance under the surface of the head of the device. This means the lance comes out for a few thousands of a second to make a puncture then recesses again. It is less painful than any other lance I'e ever used. For the pain saving alone, it was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pilchard

customer_reviews.title: Way less painful.
customer_reviews.text: At the first glance, I was disappointed because it looked like a fragile and cheap-made device. However, after I tired it first time, I was sold and couldn't wait to write a 5 star review. I have a very sensitive hand and lancets device always scare me. Not only did this one draw less blood, but also it is much much less painful than my other two mainstream lancets devices. I'm no longer having a lancets device phobia. I just wish it would be a better made one. But, it does its job perfectly and way exceeds my expectations. I'm happy about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A proud mother

customer_reviews.title: ... 50+ years of using lancing devices this is the best I have found
customer_reviews.text: Over the past 50+ years of using lancing devices this is the best I have found. For me a setting of 3 is painless and gets the sample size I need. I ordered two of these devices to have one to use on our dog. Even set on the highest setting of 10 it will not get a sample from the dog's paw. I requested help on how to modify the unit to get deeper lancing but have not recieved a reply. My request was to Amazon so I do not know who dropped the ball. If you are a human get this device, if you are a dog don't.
customer_reviews.author: RVer Traveler

customer_reviews.title: 10 - which is usually a good thing -not not on this.
customer_reviews.text: In this purchase, a 10 is not good. It is supposed to be adjustable in setting the needle punch - but this is stuck on 10 and will not twist. The item is defective in that respect - the rest of the operation of the unit seems to be okay.
customer_reviews.author: P. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with OneTouch UltraSoft lancets
customer_reviews.text: This CareTouch works just fine with my OneTouch UltraSoft lancets. My OneTouch lancing device broke and I bought a ReliOn device at WallyWorld. It was a piece of junk... every time you went to set the spring it wouldn't hold. You had to do it 3 or 4 times before it would catch, and they won't accept returns for diabetic supplies. The CareTouch is even nicer than my original OneTouch, and it's green... go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good lancing device!
customer_reviews.text: I waited to review this product to avoid the "I am excited about my new toy!" type of review. After using this lancing device for 90 days, I definitely recommend it. It consistently provides lancing. There is no fluctuation in stick depth. The unit is easier to hold onto than the OneTouch lancing device. I really like the lancet ejector; a simple slide of the tab and the lancet is ejected. No more struggling to remove lancets as with the OneTouch device. Having ten depth settings, rather than the seven on the OneTouch device, is nice as well. This device is well designed and manufactured. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better design and adjustability
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several manufacturers and designs of lancet devices. I am a new user of this one, and so far, I am quite pleased. After 20 years of finger callous', I need a deep injection and this item has enough adjustment for me. The ejector is easy to use and works effectively. I find it a bit cumbersome to use. It's very easy to reset the depth adjustment accidentally when removing the top to load a lancet. It's also necessary to rotate the device to utilize the injector. It's not perfect, but it's the best I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Ebbett

customer_reviews.title: but I'm happy to be able to adjust it so that if ...
customer_reviews.text: After losing a vital piece to my lancing device, I went onto Amazon to purchase it- only to blink at the cost and so I started looking at other lancing devices and came across the Care Touch. It has ten levels of penetration- I still only require the first level to get adequate blood, but I'm happy to be able to adjust it so that if my fingers start becoming stubborn... I can go up slightly rather than have a choice: no blood v hemorrhage. It feels steady and not at all flimsy, and it's very simple to change out the lancet. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rice

customer_reviews.title: The lancet (needle) does not retract after use.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to glucose/ketone monitoring as a long distance runner. I bought this lancing device to have an extra for my wife based on the reviews. Never did I imagine a device would leave the needle exposed after use (even though I would be replacing the lancet). It’s in the trash. (It broke when I was considering returning it). I moved to the Microlet lancing device and found it able to function as expected.
customer_reviews.author: J. Black

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful granularity of settings
customer_reviews.text: I very much like this lancet device's many settings for depth of lancet puncture. Many lancet devices out there start at HOLY CHRIST and go on up to I AM NOT A SEAL AND DO NOT APPRECIATE THIS HARPOONING. This one takes the cake when it comes to offering very gentle puncture depths. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is that the head keeps coming unscrewed and falling off. It seems like it would take only a trivial design modification to prevent that, as in, make the threads go 50% deeper, or more, so it isn't so trivial for it to come unscrewed on its own. Make that change, and I'll give it an enthusiastic 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Vaas

customer_reviews.title: Best finger
customer_reviews.text: I've been diabetic for over 50 years so I've seen many lancet device's. I'm not a fan of the small ones and recently lost my old favorite. It's hard to get excited about a finger sticker but this one rocks. It feels solid the tip is secure. One cool thing and I didn't realize it till the 3rd use, it has a concave tip. Amazing how it improves the process.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Hassman

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice lancing device
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice lancing device. While it isn't completely painless, I find it is less painful to use than other devices I have. What I really like about it is that the button isn't so sensitive that it "fires" when you don't want it to. The cap covering the lancet doesn't fall off easily and the lancet doesn't shoot off the device. Another lancing device I have does all those things, so this is a big improvement for me. .I was getting rather tired of "lancet missile" projectiles that I had to search for.
customer_reviews.author: Read for Life

customer_reviews.title: I just plain like it and thank them
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my second one as a backup. I have been diabetic for over 56 years and have seen many changes in BS control.Many of the lancing devices that come with the various meters are more concerned with the looks of their devices and don't consider the ease of use,the feel and age of the user. I just plain like it and thank them . Also , if your using this for your child, the others make a bang sound.This one is quiet. It is inexpensive and worth giving it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Works great - Love the 10 depth settings
customer_reviews.text: Works great - Love the 10 depth settings. I have used the ReliOn system for years and it worked well until the lancer wore out. I purchased the Care touch lancer and it works better. I am very happy with its ease of use and multiple depth settings. I like the lancet ejector as well. I have only used it a few times so far, but it seems to produce less pain, while providing a suitable blood sample. I started with depth 5 and will experiment with other settings. I expect good things.
customer_reviews.author: Kokopelli

customer_reviews.title: Best lancing device I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I have always used the One Touch Delica lancets for glucose testing. The only reason I purchased this lancing device was so I could use the free lancets that I received when I purchased the Genultimate test strips and I'm so glad I did! This device is far less painful than my One Touch device and provides a good bolus without having to squeeze my fingertip. This will be my standard device for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: BlutoBird

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and Simple
customer_reviews.text: The Dr. had set my husband up with the freestyle meter and lancet device which constantly would pull apart and was frustrating to use. After reading a ton of reviews I decided to order the Care Touch. He really liked the way it worked, however we were first trying it using the leftover Freestyle lancets and although they worked it required the tweezers to pull it out when done. I ordered a 3 pack of the Care Touch lancets which actually showed up overnight just through a regular Prime order! Now the device is very smooth and simple to use! It's also easy to remove the used lancet. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Design Girl

customer_reviews.title: Almost a really good lancing device.
customer_reviews.text: The manual operation of this lancing device is spot on! The only issues I found were these. First, when clicking the button to make it lance, the lancet goes forward, into the skin but does not come back. The sharp tip of the lancet remains in the skin. When using alternate sites for lancing, this is not good. Second, the hole in the tip of the clear plastic is too small for alternate site testing. I had to drill this out a bit to keep the drop of blood from wicking onto the tip.
customer_reviews.author: Bobb R

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made ineffective prot
customer_reviews.text: Extremely cheap product, the depth is stuck at 10 and won’t adjust and my standard lancets do not extend far enough to prick skin. My cat has had diabetes for 5 years and this is the worst product I’ve encountered- complete waste of money- not worth the trouble to return so its in the trash - no idea how this device could possible have such a high rating. Unfortunately I depend if these when choosing! Bad advice!
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: One of Many
customer_reviews.text: This is one of many that I have tried and none of them really work. It must be something I am doing wrong, but it takes me several tries before I am able to draw blood. I hate to put my dog through all the attempts. I now use the device just to hold the lancet and then I manually stick the lancet. That way I only have to do it once.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J

customer_reviews.title: No pain!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my aging mom who is a diabetic and chronic. Pain. When she would stick herself with her previous lancer. She's been pricking her finger since I was a kid. She said this lancer cause her no discomfort. She was so surprised. A.lancer with no discomfort?? Crazy?? Probably, but that's what she said. I am so grateful. The price is reasonable and it's easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Bowler

customer_reviews.title: Great little item!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice and reasonably priced lancing device, better than any that came with testing kits. The 10 adjustable depths are well marked and easy to read--that's a plus! If you find your current lancing device is less than satisfactory on differing fingers that work better with differing depths, you will want this one. While I found my missing device and by the time it arrived didn't really need this, it's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: pulia

customer_reviews.title: Works for Alt site Testing
customer_reviews.text: Most brands of lancing devices do not draw enough blood to fill my meter's test strip with just one stab. This Lancing Device is one of only two brands that do that for me. The Care Touch Care Touch CTLDA Adjustable Lancing Device gets 4 stars instead of 5 because from me because only the highest setting works for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Deluca

customer_reviews.title: Great tool at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful lancet tool. Performs consistently and works better than ones for three times the cost. My only minor complaint is the difficulty in cleaning the transparent top. When small bits of blood dry between the moving parts it's very difficult to fully clean. I soak the top at that point but even that does not always work. Other than that aesthetic point, it's a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kittrell

customer_reviews.title: Nearly painless.
customer_reviews.text: Having to prick your finger sucks, let's face it. This little guy works well. Little bit better construction than the usual that's packed with most meters. Easy to dial in depth and to remove used lancets. Once you get the depth set (1-10) the spring loaded "prick" is quick and about as painless as you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Cooley

customer_reviews.title: Great product, glad i found it
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new lancing pen since I managed to lose my old one! I'm glad I found this one. It's really straight forward and easy to use. My 2biggest complaints with the old one was how hard it was to remove the lancet and how hard it was to figure out what depth you were on. This one solves both those issues. There is a tab to push the used lancet out. And there are clearly labeled numbers to show what depth you'd on.
customer_reviews.author: Cdunker

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The instructions were not clear. I thought it was broken, but I wasn't using it properly. I had to search YouTube for some help, but didn't find videos that showed you exactly how to do it, just one where the woman talked about her lancing device and twirled it in her fingers. You have to have the right depth set and after you pull the charger, it should work fine. Don't reuse lancets because they get dull and will hurt more.
customer_reviews.author: KeesKraut

customer_reviews.title: My diabetic cat prefers this device....and so do I!
customer_reviews.text: Works much better than the lancing device that came with my glucose monitoring kit. I test on his ears using #6 setting, be sure you press down firmly when triggering. The clicking noise doesn’t bother him and it’s much easier to draw blood the first time with this device. He’s a much happier cat now!
customer_reviews.author: catmom

customer_reviews.title: Pain free!
customer_reviews.text: I used a fine lancet with this device and on setting number 1 I couldn’t even feel when it pricked my finger! I thought it didn’t work but it did! I’ve never had a lancing device that was this gentle yet effective! Tempted to buy an extra just in case it breaks or I lose it. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie J.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use & Handy to Have
customer_reviews.text: My husband really likes this Lancet Device. It is adjustable so he is able to get through his think skin on his fingers. The device is easy to use: You take off the cap, insert and lock in the lancet, cocking it back, replace the cap and adjust to the setting you prefer, then press to skin and push the button. It is quick and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: No Pain
customer_reviews.text: Great price and way better than the Lance my meter came with. It has 10 settings, I only need setting #1 for my finger and it doesn't hurt at all. I use #10 for my forearms. It's hard to get a good sample on my arms but that may just be me. Either way, this makes you wonder if you've even broken skin when you use it, it has so little discomfort. I get a great sample from my fingertips. Still, no pain. I really recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Nice depth adjustment
customer_reviews.text: My previous lancet device had adjustments from 1 to 5 and I would often have trouble getting enough blood on setting 5. This device has 10 settings which goes deeper than my previous five, which gives me a better size drop and I am no longer getting not enough blood errors on my meter.
customer_reviews.author: TXJustin

customer_reviews.title: Used this to test my blood sugar levels after meals ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this to test my blood sugar levels after meals while doing a ketogenic diet. The needle never went above the level of the top of the device, though, so when I pressed the button, it would eject the needle but wouldn't prick my finger. So I had to improvise and take off the top part and just hold the needle directly against my finger before pushing the button. This led to varying depths of injection (and pain).
customer_reviews.author: Meg Hauser

customer_reviews.title: This one works fine. It has 10 settings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my Freestyle Freedom lite meter since the lancing device that came with the unit never gave me enough blood. This one works fine. It has 10 settings. I am using it on 9 and get enough blood every time. The lancets that came with my device fit this unit without a problem. It is well made and should be durable. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: TRB

customer_reviews.title: Really nice. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I needed some extra lancing devices because I had 3 glucose monitor kits and only one of them had a lancet. I bought 2 and they work really well. They look nice, which is a plus... They weren't expensive... always important... and even though they might look long, they fit just fine in my kits.
customer_reviews.author: Dva

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this device. Since my doctor had wanted me to test my blood sugar 4 times a day, I had been struggling to do it. This one is the one that works for me. Its painless, and it works the first time. I replaced the lancing device that came with my meter with this one, and too my surprise, it fit in the lancet holder in the kit as well. I am ordering another just in case something happens to the one that I have.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer hedlund

customer_reviews.title: Needs adjusted every time, no alternative site
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use. But needs adjusted every use. No point to preload lance, itll be out of place when ready to use. or you're just be poking yourself and don't get any blood. Definitely can't be used for alternative sites. Cheap, and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Risa

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second lancing device I’ve purchased. My only complaint is that sometimes I can only set the lancing intensity on 9 or 10, which applies much more pressure than is necessary. The accuracy of the intensity setting isn’t consistent. However it works well enough for me to keep using device.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Something simple but no universal.
customer_reviews.text: The unit is a little shorter than the average dispenser. When you activate the needle it doesn't go in at full depth. You have to press unit on to skin to get a good blood drawn. No idea why something so simple can't be universal.Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Caraballo

customer_reviews.title: Works well hard to set up
customer_reviews.text: With no directions I had difficulty inserting lancing tip . Not sure how to remove cap I was afaid of damaging device. After finally removing cap and installing lancing tip the unit met my expiration and lances very well (4 stars)
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: So as AST I was not impressed with the design of this lance device problems below. 1. The depth penetration indicator settings arrow has no highlight colour but is green as the device cover, so difficult to see. 2. The clear plastic cap is not wide enough to see if you have a good sample. 3. The dial setting will get stuck if you go beyond 10. 4. Numbering of the numbers are on the clear cap and are hard to see. 5. Sometimes the lance does not always perform when the lance cover in twisted back onto the lance carrier.
customer_reviews.author: westgermanic

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful replacement for UltraSoft
customer_reviews.text: My mother loves this lancing device. She was partial to her UltraSoft and was disappointed when it finally broke. I got this as a replacement, and she likes it just much. It also fits her UltraSoft lancets, which are the only ones that don't hurt her fingers, she says.
customer_reviews.author: Thatgirl

customer_reviews.title: Most Other Devices Work Better
customer_reviews.text: It takes more steps to load the lancets in this device than in others. It is also difficult to see where to line up the spots to connect the top and bottom. I finally took a White-Out brush and made marks on both so I can see exactly where to start.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable - Falls apart.
customer_reviews.text: It worked extremely well for a short time, then the trigger button fell off. I needed to test but my lancing device failed me. I had to stab my finger with a lancet. Will not trust this company again. If you're looking for a reliable device look elsewhere. I've been T1 D for 50 years. This is a poor choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jim McWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Care Touch Lancing Device
customer_reviews.text: This was much better than the lancing device that came with the Freestyle lite from Abbott. Their newer lancing device in their kits did not pierce the skin unless it was at #5 and sometimes not even then without a lot of pain. Somehow the Care Touch lancing device pierces the skin at a lower number and is so painless I couldn't tell if it drew blood.
customer_reviews.author: Ohana

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works well
customer_reviews.text: I really like that there are 10 different depth settings. I find #2 works on most fingers. This device is very light weight so it's not super sturdy but so far after several weeks it's holding up well. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JRL

customer_reviews.title: Holds Up
customer_reviews.text: The seller wanted my opinion on the product the day after I received it. I told her I couldn't give it a value until I tried it out for a reasonable period. I've had it a few months now and I'm pretty happy with it. I haven't see any signs of it weakening.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas Nightmare

customer_reviews.title: Almost good, but...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my mom. I did not like the settings of the product. Though it says the depth level can be adjusted, this works poorly. The depth level does not change from 1 to 3 but it jumps all of a sudden at 4. Since level 4 is okay for me, am using it (helping it).
customer_reviews.author: Harsha

customer_reviews.title: Unable to adjust lancet depth
customer_reviews.text: The top of the device could not be turned to adjust the lancet depth. I would not buy this product again. Update: I advised the Seller of my problems with this device and they promised to send me a new one. Two weeks have passed and I still haven’t received a replacement or heard from the Seller again.
customer_reviews.author: sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Even at 10 not deep enough for my old fingers, disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because the ones I had (furnished by testing company) would not prick my finger deep enough to get a good blood sample. So with settings on 1 to 10 I was sure this one would solve the problem, not so. At 10 its not working well and ruined two test strips trying with the smaller blood drops on an INR test strip; I'm on Warfarin for life! I finally had to just use the insert and hand stick my finger; OUCH! Not a fun thing to do.
customer_reviews.author: J. Talley

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement lancet
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. The lancet that came with my Freestyle meter broke, and the replacement that was sent to be broke as well. This Care Touch lancet is perfect. Plenty of adjustments for depth (up to 10). I'm currently set at 5. I also like the slimmer handle. It fits well into my travel kit that contains all of my supplies, insulin and syringes.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Freund

customer_reviews.title: Great little device
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace our more expensive lancing device and this one is so much better! We do not have diabetes but like to keep record of our glucose. This device is adjustable for the thickness or thinness of your skin and is not painful like the more expensive device.
customer_reviews.author: C Breeze

customer_reviews.title: get one that comes with lances...this is unusable as it comes (need to buy lances seperately)
customer_reviews.text: The description wasn't clear that this product is unusable without buying separate lances. I found another offering that came with a bunch of different lances (and different sizes of lances) for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: My mom is a chicken when it comes to pricking her finger. This allows her to just push the button and get it done quickly. Its lightweight but feels a little flimsy that it may break if it falls or gets stepped on. However it not that expensive and gets the job done and not complicated to install needles in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Lancet Device for All Ages
customer_reviews.text: This is the best device I've ever used for in 22 years since being diagnosed. Once you find your depth setting, the pick is painless and consistent. It has a lever to eject the lancet after use as well (prevention of post accidental picks). I'll reorder if necessary! Enjoy and continue to take control of your life!
customer_reviews.author: Sentwali

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: i like this one bc there are 10 settings. for some of my more frequently poked tough fingers i use the 4th setting but usually 3 works but i haven’t been checking my sugars for years like some. it is a little long and only JUST fits in my case but it does fit.
customer_reviews.author: Holly B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Puncture
customer_reviews.text: My husband has Diabetes. His fingers are calloused from testing over many years. He has tried countless Lancing devices because he couldn't find one that was strong enough (on its highest setting) to penetrate his finger tips successfully. The first time he used this device he said, "now that's a keeper".
customer_reviews.author: Honesty Counts

customer_reviews.title: 10 Settings Makes It So Much Better
customer_reviews.text: My current lancing device only has 5 settings and it's either too hard or too soft. That's why I bought this one with the 10 settings. It is so easy to load/change the lancets, ready it for use, and to find your setting. So easy to use and durable!
customer_reviews.author: Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Well made, and consistent, with more adjustment than most devices.
customer_reviews.text: A solidly made lancing device with rear cocking, a crisp "trigger", and plenty of depth adjustment, it also penetrates to a consistent depth. I won't say it's a pleasure to use, but it's far better than my old device, which often failed to penetrate or went too deep all on the same setting.
customer_reviews.author: D. G. R.

customer_reviews.title: It hurts
customer_reviews.text: I wanted another BD Lancet device and tried this based on reviews. When using it on my fingers it hurts even at the lowest setting, and I'm not a wuss. I did try it on my arm though, and it doesn't hurt there.
customer_reviews.author: Cil

customer_reviews.title: Care Touch Adjustable Lancing Device
customer_reviews.text: Very nice device as it is very adjustable. Can be adjusted to almost no feel at all but the sharpness of the lancets still perform their job in bringing a drop of blood to the surface. So much better than the little gray one of Bayer.
customer_reviews.author: CatMac

customer_reviews.title: well made product
customer_reviews.text: The Care Touch lancing device is exactly what I needed. It works well; has an eject slide making it easy to remove the lancet; also is well made; and very easy to understand how to use. Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Oltman

customer_reviews.title: Well designed lancing device!
customer_reviews.text: This Care Touch Lancing Device with 10 adjustment levels is perfect! I got it to replace an OWell lancing device that had only 5 adjustment levels that was barely puncturing my skin when it was set at the highest level. I had to squeeze my fingers to get enough blood for testing. The Care Touch lancing device works great... one click does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: VC

customer_reviews.title: Best device ever for tender fingers
customer_reviews.text: This is the best device ever. I can control the depth of the strike. This with thin gauge lancets made it a pain free experience for me a prediabetic terrified of blood and needles. I highly recommend if you have tender fingers!
customer_reviews.author: C. Frund

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the lancers for this device using the same brand. It sits too deep and doesn’t reach the skin. Maybe a knock off not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Rondon

customer_reviews.title: Replacement lancing device
customer_reviews.text: Through my health insurance, I received a free glucose meter with unlimited test strips and lancets. Good deal! However, the included lancing device failed to draw enough blood. I ordered the Care Touch based on customer reviews. It works for me, first time and every time. No more repeated "sticks." I use alternate site testing (back of forearm).
customer_reviews.author: Mary K

customer_reviews.title: nice 30gauge lancets
customer_reviews.text: Care Touch lancing device have made testing so much easier at an affordable price. Adjustable depth, nice 30gauge lancets. My old device usually hurt and the spring would make me jump. This device is smooth and I no longer dred the daily testing as I did before. I just received my second because of fear that when I do need to replace it, I might not be able to find it. Very happy with this lancing device.
customer_reviews.author: M. Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Lancing Device that gives you exercise.
customer_reviews.text: The lancing device works well after you force the lancets into the device which has a narrow port of entry. You’ll have to pull the lancets out of the device but ... the device does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these based on their super cheap price and great reviews to replace the ancient ones I've been using. Unfortunately, on both of them, the lancets don't fit through and exit the cap at all. I tried several different brands of lancents that I had and not one of them worked. I had to purchase another product - cost a few bucks more, but actually works.
customer_reviews.author: R. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: It's not good for a diabetic who does a gloocoes test multiple ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not worth it. It stings too much. I have it set on 1, that's the lowest it could be, and I'm using it since Saturday evening and my fingers are nume, it hurts. It's not good for a diabetic who does a gloocoes test multiple times a day. If someone knows of a good one please let me know ASAP. Thanks P.S. It's not even 1 star!
customer_reviews.author: Moshe

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: This lance it is for my elderly mother, who has macular degeneration. She can easily find this as it's a bright color, I did have to show her how to use it as it's different from her original one, but I think she'll be able to manage. She especially likes the adjustable depth. It works and fits her lancets.
customer_reviews.author: Melynny

customer_reviews.title: not as great as the original
customer_reviews.text: the settings for depth don't seem to be accurate. I was hoping it was a good as the one that came with the meter. I don't expect this to last very long
customer_reviews.author: Doc Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Third Lancing Device
customer_reviews.text: I've used devices from AccuChek and Beyer. It is my opinion that the Care Touch was the easiest to use. My only complaint is that each manufacturer has its own proprietary lancet needles....so now I have two that I no longer use. Anyways, I like this one and we'll see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Heisenberg

customer_reviews.title: This lancing device is almost perfect in every way
customer_reviews.text: This lancing device is almost perfect in every way. Unlike most diabetes supplies, it appears to have been designed by someone who actually has experience with diabetes. Having 10 depth settings is really, really nice, and it's the perfect size; small enough to be discreet, but not so small that it's easily fumbled. My only teeny tiny complaint is that I often get the "trigger" button confused with the decorative ridge on the back, but I think that's due more to my own inattentiveness than to faulty design.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Elizabeth Cox

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement lancet device
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace device I received with my current glucose monitor. This device has 10 depth settings as opposed to the standard 5. The longer length makes holding it a breeze and can accommodate many brands on lancets. Very happy with this device
customer_reviews.author: A. Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Defective!
customer_reviews.text: The first two Caretouch lancing devices worked perfectly everyday for a year, until I lost one. The third arrived defective: the cap won't stay on, and the mechanism doesn't work. It fires immediately every time. What would the fourth do?
customer_reviews.author: Holdwine

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well with TruePlus lancets
customer_reviews.text: Liked the option for adjustable depths, but the TruePlus lancets did not fit will and took at least 10 tries of loading and reloading to get to work. Might work well with other lancets, but not TruePlus
customer_reviews.author: BauPow

customer_reviews.title: Painless Lancing
customer_reviews.text: My lancing device was giving me trouble, so I decided to look for a replacement. The Care Touch looked like a good deal so I ordered it. It works great and is less painful that the one that came with my meter. I use 30 gauge lancets. It produced a good sample painlessly. Seems a bit flimsy, but it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Filup d'Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good poker but no lancing device
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with any lancets! I thought it would be included. It was a pain having to order this and then have to order lancets seperately. Other than that, it works well and causes my son very little pain, which is why I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Praise for a new lancing device.
customer_reviews.text: I am a physician and have been using lancing devices for many years; this lancing device is the easiest to use and has a great safety feature: it ejects the needle for you, and you are less likely to stick yourself. I love the device and have 3 in my possession now. I recommend it for anyone who uses a lancing device.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective.
customer_reviews.text: Disliked the fact that this item arrived defective. The cap refused to stay on the device. Not worth going through the hassle of returning. In lieu of that choice, I ordered a much cheaper brand that included 3 devices and 300 lancets. Very happy with the second purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A. Beeman

customer_reviews.title: Great product to Replace Ultra 2 Lancing device at half the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device as my original one would no longer hold the lancet properly. This is a much better quality product that the original Ultra Touch 2 lancing device that came with the meter at about half the price of a Ultra 2 Lancing device. It also has more adjustments that allows for a softer less painful lancing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than One-touch.
customer_reviews.text: Ten times better than the one that came with the One-touch kit. It's stronger and more solid. Being larger, it's easier for my old fingers to use.
customer_reviews.author: The Riz

customer_reviews.title: Cap loosens easily
customer_reviews.text: Basic lancing device. Annoying that the cap is so loose. Follow up - stopped using it because the cap was too loose and it wouldn't work right. Not worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: acatslady

customer_reviews.title: Great Save for Me
customer_reviews.text: My pin’s spring broke so I was forced to get this in a rush. Great surprise; much better product for diabetic support. Adjustable needle is a BIG +++
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Quality lancet device
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lancet device. I needed one that had multiple levels. After several years of finger sticks, it was getting harder to draw a blood drop with convential lancets. I am only using a 7, so there are other options for the future. I like that this device is more sturdy then most others. Good price for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Budding Blogger

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: it's a very soft touch, much less painful than the one I've been using for a long time. It's cheaply made so we'll see how long it holds up, but at $7 -- hey, if it makes it a year I'll be delighted.
customer_reviews.author: hideovideo

customer_reviews.title: I find it not for Me
customer_reviews.text: Very cool looking yet a bit hard to know if it ready to use. As for the feature of ejecting...that can seem like a rocket! It does poke very well and does not hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Boyd

product_meta.title: Care Touch Care Touch CTLDA Adjustable Lancing Device, Shape
product_meta.description:
Size:Lancing DeviceThis Care Touch lancing device has advanced technology for precise guided delivery which means less pain and the smallest blood sample. It has a unique design so it's comfortable to hold. Unlike most other lancing devices, This lancing device has a choice of ten depths of penetration.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
Not Applicable
feature_bullets: Ejector button pushes the safety lancet out to prick skin

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
